gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਟਕ ਧ੍ਰਯਾਨ ਹੁਤੇ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮੇ ਚਕੋਰ ਗਤਿ ਪਲ ਨ ਲਗਤ ਸ੍ਵਪਨੈ ਹੂੰ ਨ ਦਿਖਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Ik Tak Dhyaan Houtay Chandramay Chakor Gati , Pal N Lagat Svapanai Hoon N Dikhaaeeai ?
translation: I used to see my beloved Lord without a blink of the eye as a ruddy sheldrake looks at moon. There used to be no break. But now I don't even see Him in a dream.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਬਚਨ ਧੁਨਿ ਸੁਨਤਿ ਹੀ ਬਿਦ੍ਰਯਮਾਨ ਤਾ ਮੁਖ ਸੰਦੇਸੋ ਪਥਕਨ ਪੈ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Anmrit Bachan Dhouni Sounati Hee Bidyamaana , Taa Moukh Sandayso Padakan Pai N Paaeeai ?
translation: Previously, I used to hear the melody of my beloved's sweet words from His mouth, but now I do not even receive His messages even from the passers by coming or going this way.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਹਜਾ ਸਮੈ ਨ ੳੁਰ ਅੰਤਰ ਸਮਾਤੋ ਹਾਰ ਅਨਿਕ ਪਹਾਰ ਓਟ ਭੲੇ ਕੈਸੇ ਜਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Sihajaa Samai N Ur Antar Samaato Haara , Anik Pahaar Aot Bhaay Kaisay Jaaeeai ?
translation: Previously, even the interference of the necklace around my neck was not tolerated between us at the time of our meeting on the nuptial bed, but now many mountain size customs have come up between us. How can I raise them down and reach my beloved Lord?

gurmukhi: ਸਹਜ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਰਸ ਪਰਤਾਪ ਹੁਤੇ ਬਿਰਹ ਬਿਯੋਗ ਸੋਗ ਰੋਗ ਬਿਲਲਾੲੀਅੈ ||੬੭੦||
transliteration: Sahaj Sanjog Bhog Ras Parataap Houtay , Birah Biyog Sog Rog Bilalaaeeai ?670?
translation: Previously in my spiritual tranquility, I had the happiness and bliss of being near Him, but I am now crying with pangs of separation.  (670)
